attributes.comment:
At a time when our government should make things easier for adoption, they are
contemplating making it harder. Adoption is expensive enough already, and it is
unconscionable to raise fees by up to 66% for adoption-related petitions. The
process has become increasingly harder in most Countries, the fear of the
unknown at the beginning of the process is already high for many couples who are
not familiar with the Int'l adoption process and most importantly, due to the length
of time it now takes to adopt,

many families are forced to reapply for approval and/or fingerprints before they
travel to the foreign country to adopt their child. I strongly feel this would have a
negative impact for many couples who want to adopt abroad. Please, do not
make it any harder on us then it already is!

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
